job_title: Social Rehabilitation Counselor in East Hartford, CT
pros: Great staff to work with. Everyone is pretty easy to get along with. Good support from supervisor and directors overall

review_title: Toxic leadership & toxic views on executive leadership team
pros: Work is steady, good coworkers at front desk & fellow clinicians, decent benefits, good 401k matching
cons: Dismissive of client complaints, more concerned about public image than actually fixing problems, extra work due to telehealth without extra compensation, clients often go without medication, primary care staff changes very often, much more chaotic & broken system than similar agencies in the area, very high caseloads for individual therapists (70-90 depending), poor implementation & implementation of EPIC, no continuing education offerings, no licensure reimbursement, poor communication amongst departments, inability to provide integrated care despite claiming to, claiming that 'client care' comes first without looking at broken systems, no black employees in upper management / executive leadership, absolutely no worthwhile efforts for racial equity & inclusion despite having a committee dedicated to such for 7+ months, no client support for telehealth issues, overworked/underrecognized medical assistants

pros: There are many pros to working here
cons: There are no cons to working here

review_title: The need to execute unrealistic goals set forth by management
job_title: Anonymous Employee in East Hartford, CT
pros: Pay is good for a newly-grad. Bilinguals get an extra 1$ per hour which is a plus. Decent benefits overall.
cons: Supervisors claim "no micro managing" but do exactly that. Depending on what department you work for, there are certain cliques and a lot of favoritism via supervisors.

pros: Not one thing is a pro for this job
cons: Anything and everything you could ever imagine. Too long of a list to even begin.

pros: Intercommunity employees are favored over ADRC and paid HIGHER, is that a Pro NO not if you came from ADRC
cons: ADRC  mergered with Inter-community and starting picking us off one by one. We got the IC president and management team and all IC contracts and benefits.
